sub_title:
Masters in Mechanical Engineering at Technische Universiteit Delft
Specialization: Energy,Flow and Process technology

projects.title: Design and Fabrication of vessel for efficient cooking.
projects.description: Generally, fins are utilised to dissipate heat energy. In this project, I tested the effectiveness of fins when employed in a cooking vessel. Due to the operational inconvenience of integrating fins inside a vessel, the aluminium fins were welded at the bottom of a vessel. In the project, I optimised the size and number of fins using the resistance equation. I developed four models with different spatial configurations of the fins. The final product exhibited higher efficiency and heated water to 90 degree Celsius faster (by 42 seconds) than an identical un-finned vessel. Due to the lack of a better fabrication method, air locked between the fins and the vessel during welding brought down the anticipated efficiency of the product.

projects.title: Experimental investigations of a two-stage evaporative air cooler
projects.description: The motivation for this project is the growing demand for cooling systems in India. One of the objectives of this project is to provide humidity control of the air to the user. This is achieved by providing means to cool air by direct evaporative cooling, in-direct evaporative cooling, and two stage evaporative cooling. This system can also supplant the domestic air cooler as it caters to the different climatic conditions prevalent in India.

contributors.headline:
Masters in Mechanical Engineering at Technische Universiteit Delft
Specialization: Energy,Flow and Process technology

projects.title: Investigations on a finned tube heat exchanger employed with evaporative cooling technique
projects.description: The aim of this project was to test the improvements in the heat rejection capacity of a finned tube heat exchanger by employing evaporative cooling techniques. I developed a two-dimensional steady state heat and mass transfer model using energy and mass conservation equations for air, hot water in tubes and spray water in MATLAB. I built the experimental set up and preformed experiments to quantitatively understand the improvement in heat capacity obtained with and without evaporative cooling.

profile_positions.description:
Worked on a project titled “Study on the design of heat exchangers and pressure vessel” with the Process Containment Equipment (PCE) discipline at Dow.
Prepared the inquiry package for pressure vessels, shell and tube heat exchanger and storage tank. Worked in collaboration with other disciplines within Dow to procure the design data of the static equipment based on which I chose the material of construction, insulation material and painting specifications.
Performed thickness calculations for a pressure vessel according to the ASME Section VIII Div.1. 
Reviewed vendor drawings for filters, air coolers and plate and frame heat exchangers.
profile_positions.title: Intern
